A mysterious drifter (Paul Muni) walks into a police station and confesses to a murder, offering no defense and using a false name to conceal his true identity. As he awaits his execution,  an elderly woman -1,000 miles away sees a newspaper article about the condemned man and becomes convinced that he might be her long-lost son. 

From FOX MOVIETONE is the silver screen debut of PAUL MUNI, delivering a powerhouse performance that foreshadows his legendary, Oscar-winning career. Directed by William K. Howard, this unforgettable tale of sacrifice and redemption co-stars Marguerite Churchill and Johnny Mack Brown and is a testament to the raw intensity of early sound cinema.

sources.title: The Valiant (1929)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. Lead actor Paul Muni received a Best Actor nod for this film, in addition to the picture being nominated for Best Writing. While it didn't win either award, this mystery drama examining a man on death row still makes for an intriguing watch.

metadata.Plot: After killing an unknown man for an unknown reason, a mysterious drifter turns himself to the law, under a false name intending to protect his own family's honor. But when the news of his conviction breaks, the drifter's sister and mother seeks the possibility that the man is her long lost brother.
metadata.Writer: Tom Barry, John Hunter Booth, Holworthy Hall
metadata.Actors: Paul Muni, Marguerite Churchill, Johnny Mack Brown
metadata.Awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. 1 win & 2 nominations total
